column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=1 .
#Text=Introduction
#Text=Echinochrome A ( Ech A ) is a dark red pigment separated from sea urchin shell and spine and has a chemical structure of 6-ethyl-2,3,5,7,8-pentahydroxy-1,4-naphthoquinone .

#Text=As a main active component of a commercial therapeutic agent called ‘ histochrome ’ , Ech A has been used for the treatment of cardiovascular disorders and ophthalmopathic complications in Russia .
#Text=Among the several biological benefits of Ech A , anti-oxidant and anti-inflammatory capacity is proposed as a major underlying therapeutic mechanism .

#Text=Indeed , Ech A has been shown to attenuate the oxidative stress caused by reactive oxygen species ( ROS ) and cardiac toxic drugs , providing mitochondrial protection of cardiomyocyte . Park et al. have reported similar observations showing that Ech A reduced both cellular and mitochondrial ROS levels of patient-derived cardiac progenitors during the oxidative stress situation .
#Text=The anti-oxidative and anti-viral activity of Ech A has also been proved in vitro using a tick-borne encephalitis virus and herpes simplex virus type 1-infected cell models .

#Text=The therapeutic potential of Ech A was also evaluated in an experimental gastric ulcer model where Ech A provided anti-ulcerogenic effects by increasing endogenous enzymatic and non-enzymatic antioxidant levels in vivo .

#Text=In another study , Ech A treatment could reduce ROS production and pro-inflammatory tumor necrosis factor-α ( TNF-α ) secretion in a rat model of acute uveitis induced by lipopolysaccharide injection .

#Text=These previous findings imply that Ech A could exert a wide range of therapeutic impacts on other oxidative stress-related and inflammatory pathologic conditions ; however , the cell-type specific regulation of Ech A on the immune system , which consists of various innate and adaptive immune cells , has not been elucidated yet .
#Text=Inflammatory bowel disease ( IBD ) is an intractable , chronic inflammatory disease of the digestive tract and Crohn 's disease ( CD ) and ulcerative colitis ( UC ) are the major types of IBD .
#Text=The etiology and pathogenic mechanisms of IBD remain largely unknown and both environmental factors and genetic factors combined with immunological dysfunction seem to drive IBD development .

#Text=To attenuate the excessive immune response , advanced immunotherapy using immune-modulators such as inflammatory cytokine blockers has been used recently ; however , the presence of non-responder and uncontrolled side effects are the common challenging issues when using immunotherapy .
#Text=Therefore , there has been an unmet need to develop novel therapeutics for the effective management of IBD .
#Text=In this study , we investigated whether Ech A could exhibit a protective role in IBD progression using a chemical colitogen dextran sodium sulfate ( DSS)-induced colitis mice model .

#Text=To explore the therapeutic mechanism of Ech A , we also performed in vitro proliferation and polarization experiments with two major innate and adaptive immune cells , macrophage and CD4+ helper T cells ( Th cells ) , respectively .
#Text=Our in vivo findings suggest that Ech A could attenuate the clinical signs , as well as histological improvement , for the first time in a colitis model which represents IBD .

#Text=More importantly , in vitro results demonstrate that the anti-inflammatory function of Ech A is manifested by , in part , inducing immunomodulatory effector cells , such as M2 macrophages and Treg cells .
